items.title: Review – Shelby Oaks (2025) hints at something different, but can’t keep its promises
bullets: • Shelby Oaks is a muddled, uneven experiment that never quite figures out what it wants to be
• It swings between cinematic sequences, faux-documentary interviews, and found-footage snippets with little sense of cohesion
• What starts as a promising premise erodes into a greatest-hits compilation of genre clichés

items.title: Texas proposes hiking licensing fees for summer camps by as much as 4,000%
bullets: • Texas officials have proposed hiking annual licensing fees for operators by thousands of dollars and slashing the number of camp representatives on a statewide committee that advises on industry regulations
• The Texas Department of State Health Services, which regulates camps, posted a slate of new rules to the Texas Register on Tuesday

items.title: Review: Rian Johnson Pits Faith Against Facts in Thrilling Fashion in WAKE UP DEAD MAN

• Wake Up Dead Man is a stimulating whodunit that proves Johnson has plenty of wit left in the tank, this time with a theological curiosity

items.title: At long last, the mystery of lightning on Mars is solved
bullets: • Mini-lightning strikes created by whirling dust devils on Mars have been detected accidentally by the Perseverance rover
• The chance discovery is direct evidence of a form of lightning on Mars, researchers say
• Lightning has proven more elusive on our closest planetary neighbors

• The instrument came to him through a local charity, the Olympias Music Foundation

items.title: The origins of your dog's unique look may be older than you think
bullets: • By about 10,000 years ago, half of the amount of diversity present in modern dogs was already present in the Neolithic, researchers say
• The study was published in the journal Science
• It's commonly believed that this vast range in physical attributes is a product of the Victorian era

• The National Turkey Federation says about 30 million Americans are expected to eat the bird this year

items.title: Italy's Campi Flegrei supervolcano is stirring. Could this seismic giant soon erupt?
bullets: • Italy's Campi Flegrei supervolcano is stirring again, shaking the ground in a way that scientists say it hasn't for centuries
• Two of the most recent earthquakes are the strongest we've ever seen, scientist says
• Over half a million people would have to be evacuated from an area that authorities have marked the "red zone" around the volcano's crater

items.title: Everything you need to know about Biden's student loan forgiveness program
bullets: • President Joe Biden's federal student loan forgiveness program promises to deliver up to $20,000 of debt relief for millions of borrowers
• A federal district court judge struck down the program on November 10, 2022, prompting the government to stop taking applications
• A decision is expected by late June or early July

• But how they can help kick an infection remains mysterious

• It also implements restrictions in prison housing, as well as family violence shelters

items.title: When a Road Goes Wrong
bullets: • The two-lane Interoceanic Highway was completed in 2011, connecting the Brazilian state of Acre, in Brazil’s western Amazon, to the coast of Peru
• The road runs 1,600 miles from Brazil, westward through the city of Puerto Maldonado, then winds up the Andes to Cuzado, and back down to Lima
• Instead the road has become a conduit for rampant deforestation and illegal gold mining
